name: [sulfonyl]urea-compound production | [sulfonyl]urea-compound | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9766/documentation

This dataset represents the production of  (sulfonyl)urea-compounds (1 kg of active ingredient). Raw materials are modelled with a stoichiometric calculation. Energy consumption is modelled with data from a similar process. The emissions are estimated. Infrastructure is included with a default value.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From reception of precursors (acetic anhydride, acetonitrile, acrylonitrile, aluminium, ammonia, ammonium chloride, calcium carbide, carbon dioxide, chlorine, cumene, dichloromethane, dimethylamine, dimethylsulfate, ethanol, hydrochloric acid, hydrogen, hydrogen cyanide, hydrogen fluoride, hydrogen sulfide, natural gas, nitrogen, oxygen, methanol, nitric acid, o-dichlorobenzene, p-dichlorobenzene, phosgene, 1-propanol, propylene, sodium chloride, sodium hydroxide, sulfur, sulfuric acid, sulfur dioxide, sulfur trioxide, toluene, water decarbonised) at the factory gate.

This activity ends with (sulfonyl)urea-compounds at the factory gate. The dataset includes the input materials, energy uses, infrastructure and emissions. The dataset doesn't include emulsives, additives etc.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2021:Manufacture of pesticides and other agrochemical products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The inventory is modelled for Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: [Sulfonyl]ureas are herbicidal compounds with a urea functional group (ureas) or a urea functional group having a sulfonyl substituent (sulfonyl ureas). Ureas are produced by phosgenation of an amine with an amination of the resulting isocyanate. Sulfonylureas are usually produced by reacting a sulfonamide with an amine, or a sulfonamide isocyanate with an amine, or a sulfonamide carbamate with an amine.;;The dataset [sulfonyl]urea-compounds was calculated from the arithmetic mean of all inputs and outputs of the production of amidosulfuron, chlorotoluron, diuron, isoproturon, lufenuron, metsulfuron-methyl, nicosulfuron, and thifensulfuron-methyl.;;Amidosulfuron is produced in five steps from methane:;CH4 + SO3 → CH4SO3;CH4SO3 + SOCl2 → CH3ClO2S + SO2 + HCl;CH3ClO2S + CH5N → C2H7NSO2 + HCl;C2H7NSO2 + CClNO3S → C3H6N2S2O5 + HCl;C3H6N2O5S2 + C6H9N3O2 → C9H15N5O7S2;Precursors that are used for the amidosulfuron production are amino-4,6-dimethoxy pyrimidine (C6H9N3O2), chlorosulfonyl isocyanate sulfonamide (CClNO3S), dimethyl malonate (C5H8O4), and thionyl chloride (SOCl2).;;Chlorotoluron is produced in five steps from toluene:;C7H8 + HNO3 → C7H7NO2 + H2O;C7H7NO2 + Cl2 → C7H6ClNO2 + HCl;C7H6ClNO2 + 3 H2 → C7H8ClN + 2 H2O;C7H8ClN + COCl2 → C8H6ClNO + 2 HCl;C8H6ClNO + C2H7N → C10H14ClN2O;;Diuron is produced in four steps from dichlorobenzene:;C6H4Cl2 + HNO3 → C6H3Cl2NO2 + H2O;C6H3Cl2NO2 + 3 H2 → C6H5Cl2N + 2 H2O;C6H5Cl2N + COCl2 → C7H3Cl2ON + 2 HCl;C7H3Cl2NO + C2H7N → C9H10Cl2N2O;;Isoproturon is produced in four steps from cumene:;C9H12 + HNO3 → C9H11NO2 + H2O;C9H11NO2 + 3 H2 → C9H14N + 2 H2O;C9H14N + COCl2 → C10H11NO + 2 HCl;C10H11NO + C2H7N → C12H18N2O;;Lufenuron  is produced in five steps from 1,4-dichlorobenzene:;C6H4Cl2 + Cl2 → C6H3Cl3 + HCl;C6H3Cl3 + C3H2F6O → C9H4Cl2F6O + HCl;C9H4Cl2F6O + HNO3 → C9H3Cl2F6NO3 + H2O;C9H3Cl2F6NO3 + 3 H2 → C9H5Cl2F6NO + 2 H2O;C9H5Cl2F6NO + C8H3F2NO2 → C17H8Cl2F8N2O3;Precursors that are used for the lufenuron production are 2,4-difluorobenzyl isocyanate (C8H3F2NO2) and 1,1,2,3,3,3-hexafluoropropanol (C3H2F6O).;;Metsulfuron-methyl is produced in seven steps from sulfur trioxide:;SO3 + HCl → ClSO2OH;HSO3Cl + C7H8 → C7H7ClO2S + H2O;C7H7ClO2S + NH3 → C7H9NO2S + HCl;C7H9NO2S + H2O → C7H5NO3S + 3 H2;C7H5NO3S + CH4O → C8H9NO4S;C8H9NO4S + C3H5ClO2 → C11H14NO6S + HCl;C11H14NO6S + C5H8N4O → C14H15N5O6S + C2H6O;Precursors that are used for the metsulfuron-methyl production are 2-amino-4-methoxy-6-methyl-1,3,5-triazine (C5H8N4O), cyanamide (CH2N2), ethyl-chloro formate (C3H5ClO2), and o-methyl-isourea (C2H6N2O).;;Nicosulfuron is produced in eleven steps from propene:;C3H6 + O2 → C3H4O + H2O;2 C3H4O + NH3 → C6H7N + 2 H2O;C6H7N + 4 Cl2 → C6H3Cl4N + 4 HCl;C6H3Cl4N + 2 H2O → C6H4ClNO2 + 3 HCl;C6H4ClNO2 + H2S → C6H5NO2S + HCl;C6H5NO2S + CH4O → C7H7NO2S + H2O;C7H7NO2S + 2 H2O + 3 Cl2 → C7H6ClNO4S + 5 HCl;C7H6ClNO4S + C4H11N → C11H16N2O4S + HCl;C11H16N2O4S + C4H12NAl → C12H19N3O3S + C3H9OAl;C12H19N3O3S + C2HF3O2 → C8H11N3O3S + C6H9F3O2;C8H11N3O3S + C7H7N3O3 → C15H18N6O6S;Precursors that are used for the nicosulfuron production are tert-butyl amine (C4H11N), (N,N-dimethyl amino)-dimethyl aluminium (C4H12NAl), dimethyl malonate (C5H8O4), 2-isocyanato-4,6-dimethoxy pyrimidine (C7H7N3O3), sodium (Na), and trifluoroacetic acid (C2HF3O2).;;Thifensulfuron-methyl  is produced in nine steps from acetic acid:;C2H4O2 + Cl2 → C2H3ClO2 + HCl;C2H3ClO2 + NaSH → C2H4O2S + NaCl;C2H4O2S + CH4O → C3H6O2S + H2O;C3H6O2S + CH2ClN3 → C6H7NO2S + HCl;C6H7NO2S + 2 NaNO2 + HCl → C6H5ClN2O2S + 2 H2O + NaCl;C6H5ClN2O2S + SO2 → C6H5ClO4S2 + N2;C6H5ClO4S2 + NH3 → C6H7NO4S2 + HCl;C6H7NO4S2 + COCl2 → C7H5NO5S2 + 2 HCl;C7H5NO5S2 + C5H8N4O → C12H14N5O6S2;Precursors that are used for the thifensulfuron-methyl production are 2-amino-4-methoxy-6-methyl-1,3,5-triazine (C5H8N4O), chloroacrylonitrile (CH2ClN3), cyanamide (CH2N2), sodium hydrogensulfide (NaSH), and sodium nitrite (NaNO2).;;Precursors :;;Amino-4,6-dimethoxy pyrimidine (C6H9N3O2) is produced in five steps from calcium carbide:;CaC2 + N2 → CaCN2 + C;CaCN2 + CO2 + H2O → CH2N2 + CaCO3;CH2N2 → C2H4N4;C2H4N4 + 2 NH4Cl → CH5N3 + 2 HCl;CH5N3 + C5H8O4 → C6H9N3O2 + 2 H2O;;2-Amino-4-methoxy-6-methyl-1,3,5-triazine (C5H8N4O) is produced in three steps from acetonitrile:;C2H3N + CH4O → C3H7NO;C3H7NO + CH2N2 → C4H6N2O + NH3;C4H6N2O + C2H6N2O → C5H8N4O + CH4O;;tert-Butyl amine (C4H11N) is produced in two steps from 2-methylpropene:;C4H8 + H2O + HCN + H2SO4 → C5H11NO + H2SO4;C5H11NO + H2O + H2SO4 + 3 NaOH → C4H11N + NaCHO2 + Na2SO4 + 3 H2O;;Chloroacrylonitrile (CH2ClN3) is produced from acrylonitrile and chlorine:;C3H3N + Cl2 → CH2ClN3 + HCl;;Chlorosulfonyl isocyanate sulfonamide (CClNO3S) is produced in three steps from hydrogen chloride and sulfur trioxide:;HCl + SO3 → ClSO2OH;HSO3Cl + NH3 → H2SNO2Cl + H2O;H2SNO2Cl + COCl2 → CClNO3S + 2 HCl;;Cyanamide (CH2N2) is produced in two steps from calcium carbide:;CaC2 + N2 → CaCN2 + C;CaCN2 + CO2 + H2O → CH2N2 + CaCO3;;2,4-Difluorobenzyl isocyanate (C8H3F2NO2) is produced in five steps from toluene:;C7H8 + 2 Cl2 → C7H6Cl2 + 2 HCl;C7H6Cl2 + 2 HF → C7H6F2 + 2 HCl;C7H6F2 + HNO3 → C7H4F2O2 + H2O;C7H4F2O2 + NH3 → C7H5F2NO + H2O;C7H5F2NO + COCl2 → C8H3F2NO2 + 2 HCl;;(N,N-Dimethyl amino)-dimethyl aluminium (C4H12NAl) is produced in three steps from methylchloride:;3 CH3Cl + 2 Al → C3H9Al2Cl3;C3H9Al2Cl3 + 3 CH3Cl + 6 Na → C6H18Al2 + 6 NaCl;C6H18Al2 + 2 C2H7N → 2 C4H12NAl + 2 CH4;;Dimethyl malonate (C5H8O4) is produced in four steps from acetic acid:;C2H4O2 + Cl2 → C2H3ClO2 + HCl;C2H3ClO2 + HCN → C3H3NO2 + HCl;C3H3NO2 + NaOH → NaC3H2NO2 + H2O;NaC3H2NO2 + 2 CH4O + HCl → C5H8O4 + NH3 + NaCl;;Ethyl chloroformate (C3H5ClO2) is produced from ethanol and phosgene:;C2H6O + CCl2O → C3H5ClO2 + HCl;;1,1,2,3,3,3-Hexafluoropropanol (C3H2F6O) is produced in two steps from propanol:;C3H8O + 6 Cl2 → C3H2Cl6O + 6 HCl;C3H2Cl6O + 6 HF → C3H2F6O + 6 HCl;;2-Isocyanato-4,6-dimethoxy pyrimidine (C7H7N3O3) is produced in two steps from calcium carbide:;CaC2 + N2 → CaCN2 + C;CaCN2 + CO2 + H2O → CH2N2 + CaCO3;CH2N2 → C2H4N4;C2H4N4 + 2 NH4Cl → CH5N3 + 2 HCl;CH5N3 + C5H8O4 → C6H9N3O2 + 2 H2O;C6H9N3O2 + COCl2 → C7H7N3O3 + 2 HCl;;o-Methyl-isourea (C2H6N2O) is produced from cyanamide and methanol:;CH2N2 + CH4O → C2H6N2O;;Sodium (Na) is produced by electrolysis of sodium chloride:;2 NaCl → 2 Na + Cl2;;Sodium hydrogen sulfide (NaSH) is produced from hydrogen sulfide and sodium hydroxide:;H2S + NaOH → NaSH + H2O;;Sodium nitrite (NaNO2) is produced in three steps from ammonia:;4 NH3 + 5 O2 → 4 NO + 6 H2O;2 NO + O2 → 2 NO2;NO2+ NO + 2 NaOH → 2 NaNO2 + H2O;;Thionyl chloride (SOCl2) is produced in two steps from sulphur:;S + Cl2 → SCl2;SCl2 + SO2 + Cl2 → 2 SOCl2;;Trifluoroacetic acid (C2HF3O2) is produced in two steps from acetic acid:;C2H4O2 + 3 Cl2 → C2HCl3O2 + 3 HCl;C2HCl3O2 + 3 HF → C2HF3O2 + 3 HCl

exchanges.description:
[Sulfonyl]urea-compounds can have different modes of action. Amidosulfuron, metsulfuron-methyl, nicosulfuron, and thifensulfuron-methyl are herbicides and act as acetolactase inhibitors (ALS); chlorotoluron, diuron, and isoproturon are also herbicides but act as inhibitors of photosynthesis at photosystem II site A; and lufenuron is an insecticide and acts as a chitin synthesis inhibitor.

Estimation, assuming a default value, originated from calculation of avarage consumption of electricity and heat per kg of product (3.2 MJ kg-1), and a resulting amount of electricity of 0,333 kW for every reaction step per kg reaction product, considering that the demand is made up of a mix that inlcudes 38% electricity.
